item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, October 25, 2024 at 5:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Bitwarden SDK relicensed from proprietary to GPLv3 (302 points | 93 comments)
2. Florida Eases Licensing Requirements for Foreign Trained Doctors (25 points | 14 comments)
3. Quantized Llama models with increased speed and a reduced memory footprint (324 points | 76 comments)
4. OpenFeature – a vendor-agnostic, community-driven API for feature flagging (47 points | 2 comments)
5. Launch HN: Skyvern (YC S23) – open-source AI agent for browser automations (257 points | 56 comments)
6. Why Safety Profiles Failed (120 points | 74 comments)
7. Show HN: Rust based AWS Lambda Logs Viewer (TUI) (22 points | 7 comments)
8. Security research on Private Cloud Compute (214 points | 62 comments)
9. Show HN: 2048 turned 10 this year, I built an updated version to celebrate (520 points | 174 comments)
10. Vapi (YC W21) is hiring a founding infra engineer to handle scale ( | hide)
11. Never Missing the Train Again (203 points | 72 comments)
12. Rsbuild – A Better Vite? (30 points | 19 comments)
13. Zigler: Zig NIFs in Elixir (162 points | 50 comments)
14. Brush – A new compatible Gaussian splatting engine (110 points | 28 comments)
15. Post World War II Food (183 points | 143 comments)
16. When does generative AI qualify for fair use? (6 points | discuss)
17. UnitedHealth says data of 100M stolen in Change Healthcare hack (19 points | 4 comments)
18. ST Book, the Notebook Atari ST (33 points | 6 comments)
19. The brain's waste clearing lymphatic system shown in people for first time (14 points | discuss)
20. The Script Creator (22 points | 1 comment)
21. Quit Social Media (2016) (65 points | 67 comments)
22. When Samsung meets MediaTek: the story of a small bug chain [pdf] (27 points | 3 comments)
23. Lingo: A Go micro language framework for building Domain Specific Languages (67 points | 19 comments)
24. Show HN: TypeSchema – A JSON specification to describe data models (78 points | 33 comments)
25. The Lion of St. Mark's Square in Venice Is Chinese (123 points | 39 comments)
26. TLA from First Principles (20 points | 3 comments)
27. The Anvil Text Editor (103 points | 70 comments)
28. Species in Pieces (33 points | 5 comments)
29. U.S. Consumer Watchdog Cautions Businesses on Surveillance of Workers (79 points | 13 comments)
30. Data viz project that maps all earthquakes by magnitude (61 points | 11 comments)
